website_summaries.verdict: A good hatchet at a reasonable price. Best for occasional use.
pros: Compact and lightweight enough to keep in a truck or take backpacking
cons: Hollow handle may break under heavy use

customer_reviews.title: Do not use as a hammer.
customer_reviews.text: Worked great as a hatchet, flipped it over to use it as a hammer and the head split in half.
customer_reviews.author: MB Hair Artistry

customer_reviews.title: junk
customer_reviews.text: Ended up in 3 pieces after the first use. The rear striker chipped off after 4 or 5 strikes. Then the blade stuck into the wood minus the handle 2 minutes after that. It's all in the garbage now.
customer_reviews.author: Chris Derpic

customer_reviews.title: Pot metal!
customer_reviews.text: I’ve had this hatchet for about 2 and a half years. In that time I’ve only used it 3 or 4 times. I went out to use it the other day as a wedge to split some bigger logs and the blunt end broke off after about 50 strikes with a hammer. It revealed some very pourous looking pot metal. The sharp edge is still usable but who knows when that will break too. I don’t recommend this hatchet!
customer_reviews.author: Brandon

customer_reviews.title: Makes you want to swing it
customer_reviews.text: Got it for one of my bridesmaids (since she's not the girly type). When she opened it, she had the biggest smile then started swinging it around. We were all laughing and wondering why she would randomly do that from time to time until I held it myself. This thing- must have a spell cast on it that just makes you want to swing it around. It's balanced forward, so that when you hold it, it just feels good to start chopping at stuff. Oh, it's nice. Plus the extra goodies in the handle- the flint or whatever in there sparks super bright. She'll be hacking down trees and lighting them on fire in no time!
customer_reviews.author: Kat

customer_reviews.title: great hatchet.
customer_reviews.text: This is a very simple looking but effective hatchet. It features a hard-plastic protective cover for the head of the hatchet as well as a belt hold on the cover. The butt of the hatchet holds a large ferro rod for starting fire. The backside of the axe head has a nice hammer grooving as well as a lanyard hole. Very sturdy tool. I like the simple style and the ferro rod in the handle. This seems to be a great hatchet for camping or hiking.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Nice axe but
customer_reviews.text: The axe itself is very nice, sturdy and comfortable to hold. However I was very disappointed in the packaging. The amazon box it shipped in was not damaged, but the inner Schrade box was damaged and full of dirt and dust for some reason. The inside of the box was full of oil stains and i actually had to clean the entire axe. There were also many scuff marks on the handle and blade cover that will not come off - It is very obvious I got a used item that wasnt even cleaned or inspected before re-shipping to me.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Really good hatchet
customer_reviews.text: It arrived when it was supposed to. Amazon is a little slow these days. The hatchet feels good, weight is good, I like the grips on both sides. Haven't hammered anything yet. Really worked well on some small limbs on some trees out back. I haven't tried the ferro rod, but I did scrape the coating off of it. Arrived sharp and I used a "puck stone" and leather strop and made it a bit sharper. I'd sure recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Hawkeye829

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic axe, NOT for throwing.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for throwing, this axe is terrible for that. The blade has a very large draft and so the main body is like ~.25” thick right after the edge. Axe being that thick and light simply bounces off of everything I throw it at. On the other hand this blade-body combination makes it fantastic for chopping wood by wedging itself into wood. The axe is very durable and can take a beating. It also comes with a fire starting device if you loose your lighter or just want some fireworks. Overall great product just not for throwing.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Every bit as good as I hoped
customer_reviews.text: I read many reviews about this hatchet and some were very negative about it's durability, sharpness, etc... I have used this hatchet almost 4 times a week chopping kindling from cut and seasoned pine, walnut, maple and cherry wood. It is what I had hoped as far as utility, balance, durability and of course price. It feels good in hand and easily controlled. I doubt I will use the inserted fire starter but it is nice to have since it creates a large arc of sparks if needed. Great product!
customer_reviews.author: FJK

customer_reviews.title: Love this little axe/hatchet
customer_reviews.text: Love this little axe/hatchet. Makes good kindling and I've chopped down a few small trees. The end of the blade will bend a little if your hitting something particularly hard, but it sharpened straight very quickly. The shape and length of the handle gives good leverage, so you can get more accomplished with your efforts. The fire starter is an added bonus. It's in there good, not going to just fall out. Handy to have.
customer_reviews.author: Mary W.

customer_reviews.title: Kinda small, but definately does the job
customer_reviews.text: This compact hatchet is very handy for backpack camping. I used it to cut small sapling and small limbs away from the area where I hung my hammocks, then used the hammer side to drive the stakes for rain flys. The hatchet arrived sharp enough for the work I needed it for, was ergonomic, light, and very sturdy. Hopefully it will hold up for a long time.
customer_reviews.author: Josh Ashby

customer_reviews.title: Seems okay.
customer_reviews.text: Has a good weight to it, split some wood with no problem, however after reading the bad reviews I fear this will not last long. Contemplating on returning it.
customer_reviews.author: Irving

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy?
customer_reviews.text: Haven't used it yet. Seems sturdy. Sheath is crap. Sheath is a type of Plastic that is going to break after a short time no doubt (Considering the plastic has to bend to remove the hatchet). We'll see how it goes.
customer_reviews.author: Ethan

customer_reviews.title: useful and reliable
customer_reviews.text: I just got my brother one for his birthday, I've had one for years and I love it, started many fires with the striker provided and chopped plenty of wood. Great tool for camping, the only thing I don't love is the sheath is kinda flimsy but its what they had to skrimp on to make it this price.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer SBYoung

customer_reviews.title: Great camp/survival hatchet
customer_reviews.text: Based on first impressions this was the perfect choice for my BOB/Emergency bag. It is the right size and weight. My only minor complaint, and it isn't significant enough to duduct a star, is that the "rubber" or "rubberized" hand grip feels little different than the rest of the handle. They should have used thicker rubber or gave it some texture. Actually, I have another complaint, but this was foreseen. The case that comes with SCAXE2 seems like a piece of junk. Thankfully I read enough reviews and watched enough YouTube videos to know this before choosing to pirchase. I ordered a $10 leather case along with it. It was $10 well spent.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew G. Martinez

customer_reviews.title: Best I've seen so far!
customer_reviews.text: Best Camp/Hunting axe I have found so far! It is light enough for backpacking but heavy enough to actually be useful. The reason for four stars is that although the fire starter in the end of the handle is handy I would rather have had a good lanyard instead. I like the added safety of having the axe attached to my wrist in case it slips out of my hand. The way it is there is no place to attach a lanyard. The lanyard that is shown is attached to the fire starter rod not the axe and it is designed to slip out with a gentle pull.
customer_reviews.author: BCVS

customer_reviews.title: Great Camp/Backpacking Hatchet
customer_reviews.text: These things are bad ass. For the price you can't get any better. Small, compact, well balanced. Have cut through a lot of wood with this both big and small. If you plan to use the flint stick as well the quality and size of the sparks is as good as I have ever seen for a survival type tool. Have taken this on several, very long backpacking trips and I didn't regret carrying the weight one bit by the end of the trip. Will purchase other Schrade products in the future for sure.
customer_reviews.author: Rob Herrmann

customer_reviews.title: Looks sharp, stays sharp.
customer_reviews.text: Feels good in the hand. After hacking away at roots embedded in concrete, I had to sharpen with a few swipes with a flat file and it was back to cutting! I like the blunt end for light hammering. This is a no nonsense axe with a really good grip for control. Glad I bought it.
customer_reviews.author: Laurenne J.

customer_reviews.title: My Favorite!
customer_reviews.text: I have two Granfors Bruks and an Alaskan survival axe with laminated handle. But this Schrade hit-it-out-of-the-park with it's design, ergonomics,materials and inclusive fire stick at a SUPER price point! I believe that you just can't get another quality product like this Schrade hatchet at such a reasonable price. It's relatively light, will fit in any backpack, very sharp, won't rot and therefore, is my primary survival/utility hatchet when hiking deep in the bush.
customer_reviews.author: papa diesel

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely love this. Didn't come very sharp, but, honestly, for a hatchet, that isn't very necessary. This thing is very comfortable in the hand while swinging. I'll always recommend wearing gloves when working with any blades of any sort. Anyway, I recommend highly, never get wooden handled anything!
customer_reviews.author: beyondthebox

customer_reviews.title: I recommend it honestly
customer_reviews.text: Not the sharpest, not the lightest, but very good for splitting wood or using in case of a zombie outbreak. Lol anyway there is probably better hatchets to get but this one is good for the money and high quality.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: perfect for backpacking
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely love this little ax it does alot for its size and takes a razor edge with very little work (considering mine came pretty sharp to start with) very satisfied with this purchase and the built-in ferro rod is a nice bonus and fits very secure within the handle. If there was one thing that I would change about this tool is the sheath it comes with, although it works fine it can get old taking it on and off and the long term durability of is a concern for me due to the constant folding of the material but so far its held up fine with alot of use
customer_reviews.author: Michael Allen

customer_reviews.title: Great tool to have
customer_reviews.text: I agree with all the positive reviews. I have had this hatchet for 4 years. Used in the back country and even around the house. Takes a beating and keeps ticking. Fire starter works well with hatchet and or your blade. I put this tool through hard use but you would never know it. Looks and performs the same as the day I got it. If I ever lost it I would buy the same one. Light enough on the pack I don't even notice. This and my blade are two indispensable tools in the bush.
customer_reviews.author: vanessa

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use and sharp
customer_reviews.text: I work in the national Forest and trees fall all the time. One was across the street and I used this axe to chop up the tree libms so I could drive through. It worked beautifully. Nice and sharp right out of the box. It fits nicely in my bag with the rest of my emergency kit.
customer_reviews.author: Brent Cluff

customer_reviews.title: Hatchet is good, BUT the FIRE STARTER ROD IS NOT SECURED WELL IN-PLACE
customer_reviews.text: I used it once so far. The hatchet works good BUT the fire starter rod fell out as soon as I started chopping and I could not find it in the grass. Can this rod be replaced? Do you have it available separate from the hatchet? I really want to like this hatchet but the rod gone missing on the first use of the hatchet is upsetting.
customer_reviews.author: Max Avramenko

customer_reviews.title: Schrade Axe & Firestarter
customer_reviews.text: I am very happy with this product and its packaging. Far more sturdy than I thought it would be. The axe edge did require a small amount of sharpening out of the box to get to my standards, but all-in-all, an excellent purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Crash

customer_reviews.title: This Schrade Axe is a great size for camping and hiking
customer_reviews.text: This Schrade Axe is a great size for camping and hiking. The blade is tough and keeps a good edge. The weight and balance of the axe feels good in your hand. The sheath fits nicely and covers the entire blade well. The fire starter in the handle is a nice touch. I already have another fire starter (and other fire starting materials) but having a second starter hidden away in the axe handle is good insurance against losing the other items.
customer_reviews.author: G. Phillips

customer_reviews.title: So far so good and i beat it good
customer_reviews.text: Takes a beating and the quality is right on. Blade has not dented at all and sharpness still cuts paper. Cant complain for the price and is on-par with other 3x the price. Good job
customer_reviews.author: Nel Kabal

customer_reviews.title: God hatchet
customer_reviews.text: Pretty neat little hatchet. Nice weight, pretty sharp, and the ferro-rod works super good. For 35 you can't get a better hatchet with more features than this one.
customer_reviews.author: Levi

customer_reviews.title: I like it.
customer_reviews.text: Not bad and if weight and size is an issue its not a bad pick, but keep it mind that the Fiskars X11 is only $2 more at this time and it will blow this away in the cutting department. The SCAXE2 does cut somewhat better than my Gerber Survival Hatchet, but the Gerber is much smaller, cheaper, and works almost as well.
customer_reviews.author: FR

customer_reviews.title: Overall this is a nice budget hatchet
customer_reviews.text: Overall this is a nice budget hatchet. It's nicely shaped and is an excellent size to stow in a backpack for a woods trek. My one gripe, and reason for the lost star, is with the included sheath. It works just fine, but because it is just bent plastic with a memory to it, it tends to be hard to safely put the axe back in the sheath with just one hand. The sheath feels cheap, but again, this is a budget axe so that is to be expected I suppose.
customer_reviews.author: asdfjkl;

customer_reviews.title: Packable and handy!
customer_reviews.text: Came fairly sharp upon delivery. This axe is meant for chopping off limbs and splitting smaller logs. If you have a place to sharpen the cutting edge near you, I would recommend you do so.
customer_reviews.author: David C Brown

customer_reviews.title: Solid
customer_reviews.text: This feels like good quality. Feels good in the hand and has a nice hammer surface which I was looking for.
customer_reviews.author: Samuel Rodriguez

customer_reviews.title: Good quality very sharp
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my grandson. He likes keeping survival equipment in a backpack. First thing he did was chop down a tree. This is very sharp and the sheath could be better. He likes it very much especially the fire starter. Good quality I would buy it again.
customer_reviews.author: Carmen Rich

customer_reviews.title: Not worth $35
customer_reviews.text: Broke the first time I tried to slit a small fire wood pice... wasn’t big at all
customer_reviews.author: Daniel Martinez

customer_reviews.title: Feels Good
customer_reviews.text: Excellent product, feels nice in my hand, I went out and chopped a few things with it and yep its a nice little axe chops, hammers and didn't nick or ding the blade. It actually fits in my bug out bag very nicely. Only reason it didn't get 5 stars is because it comes with a cheep strap, but that was super easy to change out with paracord. I would recommend this Axe to a friend.
customer_reviews.author: Dukes44

customer_reviews.title: This thing is so cool!
customer_reviews.text: It’s awesome. Fits the hand perfectly..feels really strong and light too! I haven’t got to hack anything with this bad boy, but I can’t wait!
customer_reviews.author: Lee Jo

customer_reviews.title: Solid hatchet
customer_reviews.text: Took this little guy camping and it did great. Full tang construction feels solid and cuts comfortably. Looking forward to continued use.
customer_reviews.author: John B.

customer_reviews.title: Love the feel of this tool
customer_reviews.text: This was a good investment. I like the size and I expect to last for a long time.
customer_reviews.author: James

customer_reviews.title: Great Survival Hatchet
customer_reviews.text: Very nice Hatchet. The Fire steel (ferro Rod) stays secure in handle. Sheath is snug and does the job well. Balanced well. Looks great. Pretty sharp rite out of the box. - watch my review on YouTube: Joe Doomsday
customer_reviews.author: Joe

customer_reviews.title: Very nice Axe
customer_reviews.text: I like it very much. It is very well made and has just the right amount of head weight to be very effective for chopping camp fire size wood. It's light enough to be used as a backpacking axe if your not a weight weenie. The fire starter stick in the handle is huge. It fits in the handle very secure and should't fall out on it's own. It seems very balanced and easy to use.
customer_reviews.author: Rico

customer_reviews.title: I like the size of this axe
customer_reviews.text: I like the size of this axe; however, it came with a rather dull edge, and after chopping a little wood for my BBQ pit it is really dull. I will have to sharpen it up and see how long it keeps an edge after use. So far it seems to be a nice purchase. I love the grip.
customer_reviews.author: Eric E. Brown

customer_reviews.title: Two for one.
customer_reviews.text: I believe in using the right tools for the right job, and this is a must have in my opinion. I've lived half my life outdoors, and I'm 50 years old. The axe makes easy work for wood processing, and the fires in the handle. I have more than 30 fire rods and this one is in my top 3 for the size of length for a shower of sparks.. A great addition to anyone's outdoors needs.
customer_reviews.author: Bradley Barber/ObsessionOutdoors

customer_reviews.title: Really great.
customer_reviews.text: I’m really enjoying the products I have bought from this company, they’re durable sharp and easy to use.
customer_reviews.author: Micah Carter

customer_reviews.title: Great little cM
customer_reviews.text: Ergonomics on this axe are excellent. Recommend over similar size Fiskar. Time will tell on the blade.
customer_reviews.author: sharpshooter

customer_reviews.title: nice hatchet
customer_reviews.text: nice hatchet , good weight to it, replace the little string on the end with some para cord. a great hatchet to have
customer_reviews.author: Barryd0927

customer_reviews.title: Not good!
customer_reviews.text: Used it a couple times and its already chipped really bad quality
customer_reviews.author: Leo ortiz

customer_reviews.title: Bad blade
customer_reviews.text: Within in 5 mins of cutting kindling, pine, blade chipped and rolled.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Made me feel like a man
customer_reviews.text: Bought for backpacking. Got to use it to chop our way out of the Porcupine Mountains in the Upper Penninsula of Michigan last fall when a snowstorm brought down numerous trees on the road. Made me feel like a man, I am not gonna lie. Great hatchet!
customer_reviews.author: Bryan Crouch

customer_reviews.title: Two Stars
customer_reviews.text: came dull does not have good balance in the hand
customer_reviews.author: W. Bailey

customer_reviews.title: Schrade Scaxe2
customer_reviews.text: A complete addition to my survival tools. A very useful rod provided for fire.
customer_reviews.author: DML

customer_reviews.title: Extremely well balanced and comfortable to your hand
customer_reviews.text: Extremely well balanced and comfortable to your hand. If you have ever used a hatchet, if it is not comfortable, you will have a blister in moments. the Fire Starting rod is really huge for many fires. The sheath is hard plastic that folds over and snaps so you can place this hatchet in a pack, trunk, or outside a pack. For the price, this is my favorite sized way to cut wood for a fire or a shelter.
customer_reviews.author: D. Stanley

customer_reviews.title: Higher Quality than Expected
customer_reviews.text: WOW, this is a nice axe! Much higher quality that what I expected. The size, grip and balance are perfect. Sharp as expected for an axe. The ferro rod sets in the handle nicely and does not budge when swinging the axe. Schrade has surprised me more than once lately and is manufacturing some great gear for the money!
customer_reviews.author: ReneMichaels

customer_reviews.title: Great hiking hatchet
customer_reviews.text: Out of the box as advertised. Great little hiking hatchet. Remember, it is a hatchet, not an ax.
customer_reviews.author: mark cain

customer_reviews.title: Love this hatchet ive been using it for over a ...
customer_reviews.text: Love this hatchet ive been using it for over a year now and must say this is a tough hatchet
customer_reviews.author: jeff

customer_reviews.title: LOVED!!!! Great hatchet!
customer_reviews.text: Awesome hatchet! I loved it! It has a really good weight to it and maximizes stroking power. The rubberized handle is very comfortable. The fire striker is high quality and easily worth 20bucks on its own. Great hatchet, highly recommend.🌟🌟🌟🌟🌟
customer_reviews.author: R. Corlett

customer_reviews.title: Bad snap on sheath
customer_reviews.text: The Axe is great !! Good balance and very nice grip. I love the textured hammer head - well done !! The Kydex sheath, though, could be designed and built better. My suggestions: One: Thicker Kydex should be used. Two: the hammer head should be exposed so it can be used while covering the axe head while the hammer is in use. Three: The snap should either be replaced with glued and stitched heavy duty Velcro or the snap should be of better quality. This axe rocks !!
customer_reviews.author: Richard Cameron

customer_reviews.title: Great hatchet for the price
customer_reviews.text: Wrap around head slightly uneven. But hasent rubbed while splitting so far so might just be cosmetic. Great hatchet that fits right on the pack!
customer_reviews.author: Doug

customer_reviews.title: Amazing for the price
customer_reviews.text: I have used this hatchet on multiple occasions now and I love it! Makes quick work of wrist size limbs and trees great addition to anyone's kit!!
customer_reviews.author: Mike Wood

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: seems pretty solid and the fire starter is a great feature.
customer_reviews.author: JW

customer_reviews.title: blade thickness
customer_reviews.text: I felt like the blade was to thick at the cutting edge. But otherwise well made
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Some reviews gave bad blade chipping
customer_reviews.text: Took this little guy camping and worked out well for chopping g up some logs. No damage to the handle and blade after use for the weekend of camping. Some reviews gave bad blade chipping . I'm sure that's from miss use of the hatchet. I use it properly not as a toy. I don't throw it and trees or objects.
customer_reviews.author: Michael P.

customer_reviews.title: Really dull out ov the box
customer_reviews.text: Really dull out ov the box, but still worked well. By shifting my grip lower I was able to get much deeper cuts. If you like to keep on your pack, I used a carabiner and it worked great. Perfect little camp/bushcraft axe.
customer_reviews.author: dropkick_sid

customer_reviews.title: Excellent addition to a recent camping trip
customer_reviews.text: Excellent addition to a recent camping trip. Light enough and durable, blade came sharp and the sheath was easy too put on/take off without issue. The fire starter in the handle took some time to get used to (had to scrape off the coating) and ended up using a knife to strike but threw a decent spark after while.
customer_reviews.author: Coryjblock

customer_reviews.title: Awesome!!
customer_reviews.text: Great price! Fast shipping! Holds a sharp edge and the flint stays wedged in the handle very nicely, so there's no worry of it ever coming loose and falling out the handle.
customer_reviews.author: Brian

customer_reviews.title: Can't recommend this axe enough!
customer_reviews.text: Great camp axe! Comfortable in the swing, holds a great edge, and multiple uses. Three things I was looking for and this covers them all!
customer_reviews.author: wetware

customer_reviews.title: Good hatchet and good fire starter
customer_reviews.text: High quality, and currently in my bug out bag, for people who says it cracks where the fire starter is in the cold I can't see it.. I used it a whole weekend for wood in about 20 degree weather and have had no problems.
customer_reviews.author: Evan

customer_reviews.title: Great overall axe!
customer_reviews.text: We got this axe for a camping trip to Fort Bragg, CA. The axe is well balanced and sharp. Also great as a hammer too. Footnote: there a few good video on YouTube (not by me).
customer_reviews.author: Jon Skinner

customer_reviews.title: Gets the job done for camping. Blade is a ...
customer_reviews.text: Gets the job done for camping. Blade is a little soft and has chipped a few times spliting a branches. But it's still gets the job done.
customer_reviews.author: ryan jordan

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Hatchet
customer_reviews.text: I have had several different Axe's and Hatchet's. This one by far is the best for the price and for quality. Holds up very well, durable and keeps an edge. Wish I would have got one of these a long time ago. A++
customer_reviews.author: mt.man

customer_reviews.title: Perfect small axe for my backpacking needs
customer_reviews.text: Perfect small axe for my backpacking needs. Factory sharp and really cuts into the wood! The fero rod in the handle is used to start all my campfires. A tip for those who are thinking about getting this- When using the fero rod, use the blade edge to strike against. You'll create more and hotter sparks with each strike!
customer_reviews.author: KReeves

customer_reviews.title: This thing is great. It has started many back woods fires and ...
customer_reviews.text: This thing is great. It has started many back woods fires and can chop well for how small and light it is!
customer_reviews.author: braidingdown

customer_reviews.title: Cool
customer_reviews.text: Awesome axe Flint sparkle works great Haven’t used it in the field just yet
customer_reviews.author: kevin

customer_reviews.title: Quality product
customer_reviews.text: Strong and hefty axe that came very sharp especially for an axe. Fire starter is secure and looks great. Sheath is neat and functional.
customer_reviews.author: Sheehan Gonzales

customer_reviews.title: Great little axe for the price.
customer_reviews.text: Very nice little axe. I leave it in the car in case of emergencies. stays sharp and has a very nice fire starter. Sometimes the blade will chip if it impacts against an item that is harder than the blade itself. I dont use it extensively enough to give speak to its durability.
customer_reviews.author: Juan Hernandez

customer_reviews.title: LOVE IT!
customer_reviews.text: LOVE IT!!! I really love how this hatchet feels in my hand. It is light but strong and is balanced. The fire starter is great addition as well and it gives off great sparks.
customer_reviews.author: Dylan Janes

customer_reviews.title: Great Product
customer_reviews.text: Love fire starter in the handle. Slides down into my pack where my water reservoir go. This and a folding saw is a great lightweight but hardcore approach to camping.
customer_reviews.author: Rye

customer_reviews.title: Lightweight
customer_reviews.text: Works great! Light weight and sharp out of the box. Would buy again!
customer_reviews.author: Ellie

customer_reviews.title: sharp and comfortable in the hand even with extended use
customer_reviews.text: Bought for my fiancé's pack / she used it several time to chop up some fire wood. Even tested the fire starter out and worked perfectly. Balanced, sharp and comfortable in the hand even with extended use.
customer_reviews.author: Travis

customer_reviews.title: Made a great gift!!
customer_reviews.text: Gift recipient says nothing is perfect but this axe is awful close!!
customer_reviews.author: Mark E. Lockhart

customer_reviews.title: Sharp!!
customer_reviews.text: Sharp! I love this tool. Just as described. Well balanced.
customer_reviews.author: Lilly M.

customer_reviews.title: Get this axe
customer_reviews.text: Great product shipped fast. Been using the axe (and fire starter) for about 4 months no complaints yet seems very durable and comes sharp when you open it
customer_reviews.author: Austin S.

customer_reviews.title: Blade edge Soft.
customer_reviews.text: The axe's blade edge is NOT hardened and tempered. So have your sharpening stone ready after chopping even soft wood.
customer_reviews.author: James Edwards

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: Really good little hatchet but the plastic cove it comes with is just trash.
customer_reviews.author: amanda

customer_reviews.title: Very pleased...
customer_reviews.text: Very impressed with this product. High quality. Came in a very fancy box, nice presentation for a gift.
customer_reviews.author: L. Lawless

customer_reviews.title: Great hatchet!
customer_reviews.text: The blade is incredibly sharp on this! I carry one in my backpack!
customer_reviews.author: RD Kepple

customer_reviews.title: BUT IT LOOKS REALLY NICE AND WORKED PRETTY WELL
customer_reviews.text: I HAVE NOT PUT IT INTO SOME HARD USE, BUT IT LOOKS REALLY NICE AND WORKED PRETTY WELL.
customer_reviews.author: RICK

customer_reviews.title: Best for the money
customer_reviews.text: For $35 bucks u cant go wrong splits and chops like a dream the ferro rod is a huge bonus love it
customer_reviews.author: alex dewey

customer_reviews.title: Best damn tool I've ever owned
customer_reviews.text: Best damn tool I've ever owned. Easy to put an edge on, and it holds that edge for a good while. Fire starter throws HUGE sparks when executed properly. Real review 8/5 stars.
customer_reviews.author: Patrick Sparks

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: it kicks ass! its very stout you won't go wrong getting this thing
customer_reviews.author: Dan Irons

customer_reviews.title: This hatchet is great. It holds a sharp edge well and cuts ...
customer_reviews.text: This hatchet is great. It holds a sharp edge well and cuts through most wood with no problem. I would definitely trust this with my life. Also the striker is a pretty sweet bonus in case you lose any other ways to start a fire.
customer_reviews.author: james

customer_reviews.title: ... be a 5 star product had they made the best strike zone for the flint anywhere but one the ...
customer_reviews.text: This would be a 5 star product had they made the best strike zone for the flint anywhere but one the cuttimg edge. The top does not emit sufficient sparks
customer_reviews.author: DS

customer_reviews.title: works great. fire starter gives a strong spark
customer_reviews.text: axe is strong and firm...works great. fire starter gives a strong spark.
customer_reviews.author: J Steiner

customer_reviews.title: GREAT PRODUCT
customer_reviews.text: Nice rubber handle not to light or too heavy just right for survival and camping purposes. Very high quality styker works awesome this is what I have been looking for thanks guys
customer_reviews.author: spandex wife

customer_reviews.title: WAY better than I expected for the price
customer_reviews.text: WAY better than I expected for the price. If I had to pick it apart Id have to say its only flaw is the sheath. It feels cheap and like it will fail over time.
customer_reviews.author: Paul

customer_reviews.title: GOOD FOR THE OUTDOORS MAN
customer_reviews.text: GOT THIS FOR THE OUTDOORS, NEVER KNOW WHEN YOU WOULD NEED A CHOPPER ORA FIRE STARTER WHEN CAMPING OR SURVIVING THE ELEMENTS.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Totally worth it!
customer_reviews.text: Its a decent little hatchet, used it to chop down some small trees (bout 4 to 6 inches in dynamiter) for fire wood. Took me about 5 to 10 minuets to do but got the job done. I loved the length of the ferror rod however i lost it while i had the hatchet on my belt (must of got caught on something while walking). Although there is ALOT of shock when using it but that along with the rod slipping are my only complaints!
customer_reviews.author: ricky v

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: I cant stop choping things down with thing. Stays very sharp and very ergonomic.
customer_reviews.author: Barri Cornwall

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Excellent. I keep this in my truck. A little light but that was expected.
customer_reviews.author: B Milner

customer_reviews.title: Very light Axe
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely great product. I carry this Axe with me on all my hikes and i don't even notice as this Axe is so light. It does what a small Axe is suppose to do. I highly recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Victor E.

product_meta.title: Schrade SCAXE2 11.8in Stainless Steel Small Axe with 3.8in Blade and Glass Fiber PA and TPR Rubber Handle for Outdoor Survival Camping and Everyday Tasks
feature_bullets: DIMENSIONS: 11.8 inch (30 cm) overall length with a blade length of 3.8 inches (9.6 cm) and a weight of 1 lb 6.4 ounces
DURABLE: Blade is made of reliable 3Cr13 Titanium Coated S.S. with a black, glass fiber filled PA & TPR material and cold resistance flexibilizer handle
DEPENDABLE: Quick and easy access with the convenient black thermoplastic belt sheath
SECURE: Have confidence that the blade will not slip with the security of the ergonomic black rubber grip
BE PREPARED: Axe features a hammer pommel as well as an extra-large ferro rod that is stored inside the shaft

Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
